verses.text: Moreover the spirit lift me up, and brought me unto the east gate of the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* house, which looketh eastward: and behold at the door of the gate five and twenty men; among whom I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.
Then said he unto me, Son of man, these \add are\add* the men that devise mischief, and give wicked counsel in this city:
which say, \add It is\add* not near; \add let us\add* build houses: this \add city is\add* the caldron, and we \add be\add* the flesh.
Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man.

And the Spirit of the \sc Lord\sc* fell upon me, and said unto me, Speak; Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Thus have ye said, O house of Israel: for I know the things that come into your mind, \add every one of\add* them.
Ye have multiplied your slain in this city, and ye have filled the streets thereof \add with\add* the slain.

Therefore thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; Your slain whom ye have laid in the midst of it, they \add are\add* the flesh, and this \add city is\add* the caldron: but \add I\add* will bring you forth out of the midst of it.
Ye have feared the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*.
And I will bring you out of the midst thereof, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.
Ye shall fall by the sword; I will judge you in the border of Israel; and ye shall know that I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*.
This \add city\add* shall not be your caldron, neither shall ye be the flesh in the midst thereof; \add but\add* I will judge you in the border of Israel:

and ye shall know that I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*: for ye have not walked in my statutes, neither executed my judgments, but have done after the manners of the heathen that \add are\add* round about you.

And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face, and cried \add with\add* a loud voice, and said, Ah Lord \sc God\sc*, \add wilt\add* thou make a full end of the remnant of Israel?
Again the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto me, saying,

Son of man, thy brethren, \add even\add* thy brethren, the men of thy kindred, and all the house of Israel wholly, \add are\add* they unto whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, Get ye far from the \sc Lord\sc*: unto us is this land given in possession.

Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; Although I have cast them far off among the heathen, and although I have scattered them among the countries, yet will I be to them as a little sanctuary in the countries where they shall come.
Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; I will even gather you from the people, and assemble you out of the countries where ye have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.
And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.
And I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them a heart of flesh:
that they may walk in my statutes, and keep mine ordinances, and do them: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God.
But \add as for them\add* whose heart walketh after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will recompense their way upon their own heads, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*.
Then did the cherubims lift up their wings, and the wheels besides them; and the glory of the God of Israel \add was\add* over them above.
And the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* went up from the midst of the city, and stood upon the mountain which \add is\add* on the east side of the city.
Afterwards the spirit took me up, and brought me in vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
Then I spake unto them of the captivity all the things that the \sc Lord\sc* had shewed me.
